subject: Data
title: The Loaded Question: Bias Before Data Exists
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Loaded Question: Bias Before Data Exists usable.

hook.text: 'Do you support cutting wasteful government spending?' 90% say yes. The data is real. The question is rigged.

buildup.text: Loaded questions use emotional or biased wording that pushes respondents toward a predetermined answer.

discovery.text: Simply rephrasing 'spending cuts' as 'reducing public services' drops agreement from 90% to 40%.

twist.text: Pollsters know this. Political surveys are often designed to generate the results the commissioner wants.

climax.text: The most powerful way to lie with data is to rig the question before collecting a single answer.

punchline.text: Control the question and you control the answer.

quiz.question: How do loaded questions bias survey results?
options: By using emotional wording that pushes respondents toward certain answers
